snippet: The jury of seven men and five women in one of the most infamous murder cases in New York’s history deliberated for a little more than an hour and a half before breaking for the evening.
abstract: Jurors in murder trial of Pedro Hernandez, accused of killing Etan Patz in 1979, begin deliberations following 10 weeks of testimony from more than 50 witness; jury of seven men and five women will decide one of most infamous murder cases in New York City's history.
lead_paragraph: The jury of seven men and five women in one of the most infamous murder cases in New York’s history deliberated for a little more than an hour and a half before breaking for the evening.

headline.main: Jury Begins Deliberations in Etan Patz Case After 10 Weeks
headline.print_headline: Jury Begins Deliberations in Patz Case After 10 Weeks
